title: Extend the authorization validity period of a TikTok post

headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Access token authorized by TikTok creators. To obtain an access token, use /tt_user/oauth2/token/ .

headers.name: Content-Type
headers.description: Request message type. Allowed format: application/json .

parameters.name: business_id
parameters.description: Application specific unique identifier for the TikTok account. Pass the value of the open_id field returned in the response of /tt_user/oauth2/token/ to this field.

parameters.name: item_id
parameters.description: The ID of the TikTok post. To obtain the public posts of a TikTok account, use /business/video/list/ . Example: 7123456789123456789 .

parameters.name: authorization_days
parameters.description: If the post already has an authorization code, this field represents the authorization extension period, which is an additional amount of time you can add on to your existing Ad authorization period. For instance, if the existing authorization period of a TikTok post is 180 days and you set this field to 180 , the authorization period of the post will be extended to 360 days. If the authorization code of a TikTok post is deleted, this field represents the validity period of the new authorization code. Supported values: 7 , 30 , 60 , 180 , 365 . Default value: 30 .
